event.title: was created from Greenbrier County in 1799

data.event: Monroe County was created from Greenbrier County in 1799 and was named for James Monroe who eventually became the fifth President of the United States.
Monroe County was formed on January 14, 1799 from portions of Greenbrier County.

event.title: was named after James Monroe, a Virginia statesman and senator, and the future

data.event: It was named after James Monroe, a Virginia statesman and senator, and the future fifth President of the United States.
